intro: Scrophularia jallui, commonly known as the Jallui figwort, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in whorls along the stem, and bloom in late spring to early summer. Scrophularia jallui is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh, high-altitude environments.
